speaker: Ivy Library
lines: Shelves bow under books that learned to breathe damp.
Vines leaf through pages and stop at pictures they like.
A lectern wears a chain like a necklace that bites thieves.
A globe spins when you pass; it stops with your finger on the sea you haven't seen yet.
Marginalia argue with authors; a pressed flower wins every debate.
Ladders lean in, nosy as old friends.
A librarian-shaped absence makes a shushing gesture anyway.
A codex on a dais hums; its lock is a riddle with three answers.
You know one of them because the wind told you earlier.

choices.text: Unlock the codex and read the city's true name.
Pocket a map of the underways.
Close the book and hear the hum fade.
